title: Initial and continuing professional development of teachers

references.title: A Case Study of 'Newer Practices" in Music Education at Conservatoire Level.
references.raw: DAVIDSON J., SMITH J. (1997). A Case Study of 'Newer Practices" in Music Education at Conservatoire Level. British Journal of Music Education. 14 (3), 251-269.

references.title: Competing Paradigms in Qualitative Research. In:
references.raw: GUBA E. & LINCOLN Y. (1998). Competing Paradigms in Qualitative Research. In: DENZIN N., LINCOLN Y. (Eds.), The Landscape of Qualitative Research. pp 195-220. London: Sage.

references.title: Educational Research: pursuit of truth or flight of fancy.
references.raw: BRIDGES D. (1999). Educational Research: pursuit of truth or flight of fancy. British Educational Research Journal, 25(5), 597-616.

references.title: Musical Learning as Cultural Practice: As Exemplified in Computer-Based Creative Music-Making, In:
references.raw: FOLKESTAD G. (1998), Musical Learning as Cultural Practice: As Exemplified in Computer-Based Creative Music-Making, In: SUNDIN B., MCPHERSON G., FOLKESTAD G. (Eds.), Children Composing. Lund University, Malmö.

references.title: The Disappearing Arts? The current state of the arts in initial teacher training and professional development, Royal Society of Arts [RSA],
references.raw: ROGERS R. (1998), The Disappearing Arts? The current state of the arts in initial teacher training and professional development, Royal Society of Arts [RSA], London.

references.title: The Myth of Rational Research.
references.raw: THOMAS G. (1998). The Myth of Rational Research. British Educational Research Journal, 24(2), pp141-161.

references.title: The Ontogenesis of Musical Behaviour: A Sociological Perspective.
references.raw: WELCH G. (2000). The Ontogenesis of Musical Behaviour: A Sociological Perspective. Research Studies in Music Education. 14, 1-13.
